action: I want to accurately manage inventory quantities, storage locations, and inbound/outbound history
reason: To prevent losses due to inventory discrepancies, stockouts, or excess inventory, and to maintain the company's logistical accuracy
acceptance_criteria: Inventory registration is only executable by authenticated users.
Only roles with inventory operation permissions can perform updates.
Product IDs must be unique.
Product IDs not present in the Product Master cannot be registered.
Inventory quantities must be non-negative integers.
Decimal or negative values cannot be registered.
Inventory updates consist of three categories: Inbound, Outbound, and Stocktake.
Processing fails if the update category is not specified.
Quantity increase processing is performed during Inbound.
Update fails during Outbound if there is insufficient stock.
Stocktake updates save discrepancy history.
Concurrent update conflicts are detected (optimistic locking).
Update fails if the version does not match.
Update history includes the operating user ID.
Update history includes pre-update and post-update quantities.
The timestamp is saved in the update history.
Storage locations (Warehouse ID and Shelf Number) can be maintained.
Specification of a non-existent Warehouse ID results in failure.
Inbound/outbound reasons (Sale, Return, Damage, etc.) are selectable.
Warning or failure occurs if a reason is not specified.
The same validation applies to updates via API.
SQL injection countermeasures are implemented (parameterized queries).
XSS countermeasures are implemented (input sanitization).
Inventory update processing is completed within a DB transaction.
Rollback is performed upon partial failure.
Inventory count changes are saved in audit logs.
Inventory alert thresholds can be configured.
A notification event is issued when stock falls below the threshold.
Notifications are processed via an asynchronous queue.
Internal DB information is not included in the response.
Inventory data is managed in UTF-8.
A bulk update function via CSV is available.
CSV processing is under transaction control.
Invalid rows are skipped and logged.
Complies with REST API standards.
API versioning is managed.
HTTPS communication is mandatory.
Rate limiting is applied.
Target response time for the update API is within 300ms.
User-facing messages and internal logs are separated upon error.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Support for periodic stocktake data import.
Stocktake discrepancy reports can be generated.
Inventory history search function is available.
Date range searches are supported.
Aggregation per product and per warehouse is possible.
Retention period settings for inventory operation logs are available.
